meanings.definition: The quality of being free from error or mistakes.
meanings.sent1: The inerrancy of the map ensured we reached our destination without any wrong turns.
meanings.sent2: Her unwavering belief in the inerrancy of her grandmother's stories brought her comfort.
meanings.sent3: The inerrancy of the weather forecast made the meteorologist feel like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: The inerrancy of his memory was like a steel trap, never forgetting a detail.
meanings.sent5: The inerrancy of the recipe was crucial for the success of the baking competition.

meanings.definition: The belief that something is without error or fault.
meanings.sent1: His inerrancy in the justice system was unshakable, always trusting it to be fair.
meanings.sent2: The inerrancy of her faith gave her strength during difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The inerrancy of his lucky socks brought him good fortune in every game.
meanings.sent4: The inerrancy of the compass guided them safely through the treacherous terrain.
meanings.sent5: The inerrancy of his intuition never failed him in making important decisions.
